*분변잠혈반응 검사 결과 음성(대변에서 혈액이 검출되지 않음)입니다. 이러한 경우
대장에 아무런 이상이 없을 가능성이 높으나 경우에 따라 대장에 병변(염증, 용종, 암
등)이 있는 경우에도 정상으로 나올 수 있습니다. 그러므로 최근 의심되는 증상(체중
감소, 대변 굵기의 변화, 혈변 등)이 있으면 의료기관을 방문하시어 진료상담을 받으
시기 바랍니다.

이치형
대장암 검진 결과통보서
※(건강보험가입자) 건강검진 결과통보서상 상급종합병원에서의 요양급여가 필요하다는 의사 소견이 기재된 경우, 요양급여
의뢰서 (진료의뢰서)로 갈음되며 본 통보서를 활용하여 상급종합병원에서 진료를 받으실 수 있습니다.
※(의료급여수급권자) 건강검진 결과 이상소견이 발견되어 진료담당의사가 검진결과서에 추가 진료가 필요하다는 의사소견
을 기재한 경우 동 검진결과서를 의료급여의뢰서로 갈음하여 검진을 실시한 의료급여기관에서 진료를 받으실 수 있습니다
그 이외의 의료급여가 필요한 경우에는 「의료급여법 시행규칙」 제3조의 의료급여절차에 따라 진료를 받으셔야 하며,
선택의료급여기관 적용 대상자는 본인이 선택한 의료급여기관에서 먼저 진료를 받으셔야 합니다.
※ 최근 발생이 급격히 증가하고 있는 대장암은 정기검진을 통해 조기 발견이 가능하며, 조기 발견된 경우 내시경적 치료
또는 수술적 치료로 완치 가능한 암입니다.
※ 대장암은 50세 이상에서 급격하게 증가하므로 특별한 증상이 없더라도 50세 이상 남녀 모두 매년 분변잠혈검사를 받도록
권고 하고 있습니다. 분변잠혈검사에 이상이 있는 경우에는 다음연도 1. 31일 까지 대장내시경검사를 통해
대장암 발생여부를 확인할 수 있습니다.
※ 대장암 산정특례자 및 「암검진 실시기준」에 따른 대장내시경 검사를 받은 수검자는 대장암검진을 유예할 수 있습니다.
※ 분변잠혈검사만으로 모든 대장 질환을 판별할 수 없으므로 분변잠혈검사가 음성이라 하더라도 의심되는 증상(체중감소,
대변 굵기의 변화, 혈변 등)이 있으면 의사와 상담이 필요하고, 검사 결과 이상소견없음 이외의 판정을 받은 경우
권고사항에 따라 조치를 취하시기 바랍니다.
※ 대장암으로 진단받은 사람 중 관련 요건(건강보험료, 국가 암검진 수검 여부 등)을 갖춘 사람은 암환자 의료
비 지원사업의 대상이 될 수 있습니다. (상세 내용은 관할 보건소 문의)
귀하의 대장암 검진 결과를 위와 같이 통보합니다.

1. Title Celiac. Superior mesenteric arteriogram & TAE
2. Procedure
After skin preparation of right inguinal region, a 10 ml of 2% lidocaine HCI was locally infiltrated and the skin is incised. The
right femoral artery was punctured with an 18G Angiocath needle and a 6 Fr arterial sheath was then inserted. A 10 ml of
saline solution mixed with heparin was injected through the sheath. Using a 0.035-inch guidewire and a 5 Fr Yashiro
catheter, the celiac trunk and superior mesenteric arteries were selected under fluoroscopic guidance. After the selective
angiography was performed. the right gastroepiploic artery was selected with a coaxial microcatheter and embolized with a
microcoil (Concerto 3-8) glue and lipiodol. Post-embolization arteriography was performed. The patient tolerated the
procedure well and no immediate complication developed. The puncture site was sealed with vascular closing device.
[CONCLUSION]
1. Active bleeding from right gastroepiploic artery
2. Uncompliated transarterial embolization using a microcoil and glue/lipiodol.

1. Title Celiac, Superior mesenteric arteriogram & TAE
2. Procedure
After skin preparation of right inguinal region. a 10 ml of 2% lidocaine HCI was locally infiltrated and the skin is incised. The
right femoral artery was punctured with an 18G Angiocath needle and a 6 Fr arterial sheath was then inserted. A 10 ml of
saline solution mixed with heparin was injected through the sheath. Using a 0.035-inch guidewire and a 5 Fr Yashiro
catheter, the celiac trunk and superior mesenteric arteries were selected under fluoroscopic guidance. After the selective
angiography was performed. the right gastroepiploic artery was selected with a coaxial microcatheter and embolized with a
microcoil (Concerto 3-8) glue and lipiodol. Post-embolization arteriography was performed. The patient tolerated the
procedure well and no immediate complication developed. The puncture site was sealed with vascular closing device.
[CONCLUSION]
1. Active bleeding from right gastroepiploic artery
2. Uncompliated transarterial embolization using a microcoil and glue/lipiodol.

Large amount of hemoperitoneum with active bleeding from GDA branch in mid abdomen

-> CT에서 확인한 대로 해당 부위 bleeding 있어 embolization 시행 + line poor 하여 c line도 시행함.
-> 이후 V/S stable

최준일
A-colon cancer로 수술 시행받은 환자임. Right hemicolectomy state
복강내 large amount의 hematoma가 있음. Pancreas head 앞에 active bleeding focus로 보이는 pseudoaneurysm이 있음. GDA
branch로 보임.
Liver에 simple cyst가 보이며 GB stone이 있음.
양측 pleural effusion이 소량 보이며 diffuse truncal edema가 있음.
[CONCLUSION]
Large amount of hemoperitoneum with active bleeding from GDA branch in mid abdomen
Small amount of bilateral pleural effusion

[FINDING]
1. Title Celiac. Superior mesenteric arteriogram & TAE
2. Procedure
After skin preparation of right inguinal region, a 10 ml of 2% lidocaine HCI was locally infiltrated and the skin is incised. The
right femoral artery was punctured with an 18G Angiocath needle and a 6 Fr arterial sheath was then inserted. A 10 ml of
saline solution mixed with heparin was injected through the sheath. Using a 0.035-inch guidewire and a 5 Fr Yashiro
catheter, the celiac trunk and superior mesenteric arteries were selected under fluoroscopic guidance. After the selective
angiography was performed. the right gastroepiploic artery was selected with a coaxial microcatheter and embolized with a
microcoil (Concerto 3-8) glue and lipiodol. Post-embolization arteriography was performed. The patient tolerated the
procedure well and no immediate complication developed. The puncture site was sealed with vascular closing device.
[CONCLUSION]
1. Active bleeding from right gastroepiploic artery
2. Uncompliated transarterial embolization using a microcoil and glue/lipiodol.
[RECOMMENDATION]

[FINDING]
1. Title Celiac. Superior mesenteric arteriogram & TAE
2. Procedure
After skin preparation of right inguinal region, a 10 ml of 2% lidocaine HCI was locally infiltrated and the skin is incised. The
right femoral artery was punctured with an 18G Angiocath needle and a 6 Fr arterial sheath was then inserted. A 10 ml of
saline solution mixed with heparin was injected through the sheath. Using a 0.035-inch guidewire and a 5 Fr Yashiro
catheter, the celiac trunk and superior mesenteric arteries were selected under fluoroscopic guidance. After the selective
angiography was performed. the right gastroepiploic artery was selected with a coaxial microcatheter and embolized with a
microcoil (Concerto 3-8) glue and lipiodol. Post-embolization arteriography was performed. The patient tolerated the
procedure well and no immediate complication developed. The puncture site was sealed with vascular closing device.
[CONCLUSION]
1. Active bleeding from right gastroepiploic artery
2. Uncompliated transarterial embolization using a microcoil and glue/lipiodol.
[RECOMMENDATION]

catheter, the celiac trunk and superior mesenteric arteries were selected under fluoroscopic guidance. After the selective
angiography was performed, the right gastroepiploic artery was selected with a coaxial microcatheter and embolized with a
microcoil (Concerto 3-8) glue and lipiodol. Post-embolization arteriography was performed. The patient tolerated the
procedure well and no immediate complication developed. The puncture site was sealed with vascular closing device.
[CONCLUSION]
1. Active bleeding from right gastroepiploic artery
2. Uncompliated transarterial embolization using a microcoil and glue/lipiodol.
[RECOMMENDATION]

(2024.12.27 Tonsil. right 외부)
HPV 58+
상기 55세 남환 타병원에서 시행한 조직검사에서 Rt.tonsil의 Squamous cell carcinoma. HPV-associated.. Rt.
neck의 Poorly differentiated carcinoma. metastatic 진단 받음. 선행항암위하여 이비인후과 (김상연Pf)에서 의뢰됨
*MRI Neck (enhance)_HNC [검사일시:2024-12-20 09:17]
Diffuse enhancing mucosal thickening at oropharyngeal wall (Rt>>Lt). including Rt glossotonsillar sulcus. Rt
palatine tonsil. bilateral lingual tonsil. tongue base. floor of mouth. bilateral vellecula and epiglottis.
: CC-axis. about 7cm.
: diffuse infiltration at Rt parapharyngeal space with r/o invasion to Rt medial pterygoid muscle.
-> biopsy proven oropharyngeal cancer.
Multiple enlarged LNs in Rt parapharyngeal. Rt carotid. and Rt neck level II.
: extranodal extension of Rt neck level II LN. with Rt SMG involvement.
->metastatic LNs.
[CONCLUSION]
Biopsy proven oropharyngeal cancer with probable metastatic LNs (T3 or T4. N3b)
*CT Chest (Lung mediastinum) (enhance) [검사일시:2024-12-20 09:57]
No remarkable findings in the lungs and airway.
No significant lymphadenopathy in the mediastinum and pulmonary hila.
No other remarkable abnormal finding in the thorax.
*CT Abdomen & Pelvis (enhance) [검사일시:2024-12-20 09:57]
No evidence of intraabdominal metastasis.
*PET CT Torso [검사일시:2024-12-20 14:48]
1. Hypermetabolic malignancy involving right side palatine tonsil. oropharyngeal wall. bilateral lingual tonsil.
tongue base. floor of mouth. bilateral vellecula and epiglottis
2. Metastatic LNs in right cervical level level II. |||
3. Reactive LN at the left cervical level ||
DDx. metastatic LN

1. Title Percutaneous Implantation of Infusion Port. right.
2. Procedure
After skin preparation of right clavicular region on supine position, a 6 ml of 1% lidocaine HCI was locally infiltrated. The right
internal jugular vein was punctured with a micropucture needle under US-guidance and a microsheath was then introduced
into superior vena cava over a 0.018-inch hairwire. The skin was incised and subcutaneous pocket & tunnel was prepared
by dissection. After dilation, an infusion port with catheter was inserted over a guidewire and a peel-away sheath. The tip of
the catheter was adjusted at the atriocaval junction and the infusion port was filled with a 10 ml of saline solution mixed with
Heparin 1.000 units for locking. The incision site was closed by applying tissue adhesive.
The patient tolerated the procedure well and no immediate complication developed.
[CONCLUSION]
Uncomplicated implantation of infusion port via right transjugular venous approach under US & fluoroscopy.
[RECOMMENDATION]

After skin preparation of right clavicular region on supine position, a 6 ml of 1% lidocaine HCI was locally infiltrated. The right
internal jugular vein was punctured with a micropucture needle under US-guidance and a microsheath was then introduced
into superior vena cava over a 0.018-inch hairwire. The skin was incised and subcutaneous pocket & tunnel was prepared
by dissection. After dilation. an infusion port with catheter was inserted over a guidewire and a peel-away sheath. The tip of
the catheter was adjusted at the atriocaval junction and the infusion port was filled with a 10 ml of saline solution mixed with
Heparin 1.000 units for locking. The incision site was closed by applying tissue adhesive.
The patient tolerated the procedure well and no immediate complication developed.

# SCC. Tonsil. Rt. HPV-associated (cT3 or T4. N3b. stage III)
(2024.12.27 Tonsil. right 외부)
HPV 58+
상기 55세 남환 타병원에서 시행한 조직검사에서 Rt.tonsil의 Squamous cell carcinoma. HPV-associated.. Rt.
neck의 Poorly differentiated carcinoma. metastatic 진단 받음. 선행항암위하여 이비인후과 (김상연Pf)에서 의뢰됨
*MRI Neck (enhance)_HNC [검사일시:2024-12-20 09:17]
Diffuse enhancing mucosal thickening at oropharyngeal wall (Rt>>Lt). including Rt glossotonsillar sulcus. Rt
palatine tonsil. bilateral lingual tonsil. tongue base. floor of mouth. bilateral vellecula and epiglottis.
: CC-axis. about 7cm.
: diffuse infiltration at Rt parapharyngeal space with r/o invasion to Rt medial pterygoid muscle.
-> biopsy proven oropharyngeal cancer.
Multiple enlarged LNs in Rt parapharyngeal. Rt carotid. and Rt neck level II.
: extranodal extension of Rt neck level II LN. with Rt SMG involvement.
->metastatic LNs.
[CONCLUSION]
Biopsy proven oropharyngeal cancer with probable metastatic LNs (T3 or T4. N3b)
*CT Chest (Lung mediastinum) (enhance) [검사일시:2024-12-20 09:57]
No remarkable findings in the lungs and airway.
No significant lymphadenopathy in the mediastinum and pulmonary hila.
No other remarkable abnormal finding in the thorax.
*CT Abdomen & Pelvis (enhance) [검사일시:2024-12-20 09:57]
No evidence of intraabdominal metastasis.
*PET CT Torso [검사일시:2024-12-20 14:48]
1. Hypermetabolic malignancy involving right side palatine tonsil. oropharyngeal wall. bilateral lingual tonsil.
tongue base. floor of mouth. bilateral vellecula and epiglottis
2. Metastatic LNs in right cervical level level II. |||
3. Reactive LN at the left cervical level ||
DDx. metastatic LN

1. Title Percutaneous Implantation of Infusion Port. right.
2. Procedure
After skin preparation of right clavicular region on supine position, a 6 ml of 1% lidocaine HCI was locally infiltrated. The right
internal jugular vein was punctured with a micropucture needle under US-guidance and a microsheath was then introduced
into superior vena cava over a 0.018-inch hairwire. The skin was incised and subcutaneous pocket & tunnel was prepared
by dissection. After dilation, an infusion port with catheter was inserted over a guidewire and a peel-away sheath. The tip of
the catheter was adjusted at the atriocaval junction and the infusion port was filled with a 10 ml of saline solution mixed with
Heparin 1.000 units for locking. The incision site was closed by applying tissue adhesive.
The patient tolerated the procedure well and no immediate complication developed.
[CONCLUSION]
Uncomplicated implantation of infusion port via right transjugular venous approach under US & fluoroscopy.
[RECOMMENDATION]

1. Title Percutaneous Implantation of Infusion Port, right.
2. Procedure
After skin preparation of right clavicular region on supine position, a 6 ml of 1% lidocaine HCI was locally infiltrated. The right
internal jugular vein was punctured with a micropucture needle under US-guidance and a microsheath was then introduced
into superior vena cava over a 0.018-inch hairwire. The skin was incised and subcutaneous pocket & tunnel was prepared
by dissection. After dilation. an infusion port with catheter was inserted over a guidewire and a peel-away sheath. The tip of
the catheter was adjusted at the atriocaval junction and the infusion port was filled with a 10 ml of saline solution mixed with
Heparin 1.000 units for locking. The incision site was closed by applying tissue adhesive.
The patient tolerated the procedure well and no immediate complication developed.
[CONCLUSION]
Uncomplicated implantation of infusion port via right transjugular venous approach under US & fluoroscopy.

2. Procedure
After skin preparation of right clavicular region on supine position, a 6 ml of 1% lidocaine HCI was locally infiltrated. The right
internal jugular vein was punctured with a micropucture needle under US-guidance and a microsheath was then introduced
into superior vena cava over a 0.018-inch hairwire. The skin was incised and subcutaneous pocket & tunnel was prepared
by dissection. After dilation, an infusion port with catheter was inserted over a guidewire and a peel-away sheath. The tip of
the catheter was adjusted at the atriocaval junction and the infusion port was filled with a 10 ml of saline solution mixed with
Heparin 1.000 units for locking. The incision site was closed by applying tissue adhesive.
The patient tolerated the procedure well and no immediate complication developed.
[CONCLUSION]
Uncomplicated implantation of infusion port via right transjugular venous approach under US & fluoroscopy.
[RECOMMENDATION]

1. Title Percutaneous Implantation of Infusion Port. right.
2. Procedure
After skin preparation of right clavicular region on supine position, a 6 ml of 1% lidocaine HCI was locally infiltrated. The right
internal jugular vein was punctured with a micropucture needle under US-guidance and a microsheath was then introduced
into superior vena cava over a 0.018-inch hairwire. The skin was incised and subcutaneous pocket & tunnel was prepared
by dissection. After dilation, an infusion port with catheter was inserted over a guidewire and a peel-away sheath. The tip of
the catheter was adjusted at the atriocaval junction and the infusion port was filled with a 10 ml of saline solution mixed with
Heparin 1.000 units for locking. The incision site was closed by applying tissue adhesive.
The patient tolerated the procedure well and no immediate complication developed.
[CONCLUSION]
Uncomplicated implantation of infusion port via right transjugular venous approach under US & fluoroscopy.
[RECOMMENDATION]

1. Title Percutaneous Implantation of Infusion Port. right.
2. Procedure
After skin preparation of right clavicular region on supine position, a 6 ml of 1% lidocaine HCI was locally infiltrated. The right
internal jugular vein was punctured with a micropucture needle under US-guidance and a microsheath was then introduced
into superior vena cava over a 0.018-inch hairwire. The skin was incised and subcutaneous pocket & tunnel was prepared
by dissection. After dilation, an infusion port with catheter was inserted over a guidewire and a peel-away sheath. The tip of
the catheter was adjusted at the atriocaval junction and the infusion port was filled with a 10 ml of saline solution mixed with
Heparin 1.000 units for locking. The incision site was closed by applying tissue adhesive.
The patient tolerated the procedure well and no immediate complication developed.
[CONCLUSION]
Uncomplicated implantation of infusion port via right transjugular venous approach under US & fluoroscopy.
[RECOMMENDATION]

1. Title Percutaneous Implantation of Infusion Port. right.
2. Procedure
After skin preparation of right clavicular region on supine position, a 6 ml of 1% lidocaine HCI was locally infiltrated. The right
internal jugular vein was punctured with a micropucture needle under US-guidance and a microsheath was then introduced
into superior vena cava over a 0.018-inch hairwire. The skin was incised and subcutaneous pocket & tunnel was prepared
by dissection. After dilation, an infusion port with catheter was inserted over a guidewire and a peel-away sheath. The tip of
the catheter was adjusted at the atriocaval junction and the infusion port was filled with a 10 ml of saline solution mixed with
Heparin 1.000 units for locking. The incision site was closed by applying tissue adhesive.
The patient tolerated the procedure well and no immediate complication developed.
[CONCLUSION]
Uncomplicated implantation of infusion port via right transjugular venous approach under US & fluoroscopy.
[RECOMMENDATION]

1. Title Percutaneous Implantation of Infusion Port. right.
2. Procedure
After skin preparation of right clavicular region on supine position, a 6 ml of 1% lidocaine HCI was locally infiltrated. The right
internal jugular vein was punctured with a micropucture needle under US-guidance and a microsheath was then introduced
into superior vena cava over a 0.018-inch hairwire. The skin was incised and subcutaneous pocket & tunnel was prepared
by dissection. After dilation, an infusion port with catheter was inserted over a guidewire and a peel-away sheath. The tip of
the catheter was adjusted at the atriocaval junction and the infusion port was filled with a 10 ml of saline solution mixed with
Heparin 1.000 units for locking. The incision site was closed by applying tissue adhesive.
The patient tolerated the procedure well and no immediate complication developed.
[CONCLUSION]
Uncomplicated implantation of infusion port via right transjugular venous approach under US & fluoroscopy.
[RECOMMENDATION]
